name: Galactic Year
description: Time for our solar system to orbit the center of the Milky Way.

name: Parsec
description: ~3.3 light years/ 210,000 astronomical units/31 trillion km/19 trillion miles.

name: Light Year
description: distance that?light travels in vacuum?in one?Julian year?(365.25 days), ~9.46 trillion km/ 5.88 trillion miles.

name: astronomical unit
description: mean(earth-sun distance),~93 million miles.

name: earth radius
description: mean(polar/equatorial) radius.

name: earth mass
description: approximate mass of the earth.

name: solar mass
description: approximate mass of the sun.

name: solar radius
description: 432,300 miles, ~10 * radius of jupiter, 109 * earth.

name: Earth Density
description: average density of all planetary material.

name: kelvin
description: degrees above absolute zero, same scale as celsius but starts at theoretical freezing temperature of all matter (save quantum mechanics), not water.

name: absolute zero
description: theoretical point where gases reach minimum enthalpy and entropy values.

name: gravity
description: effect of bent space-time. {earth=9.807, sun=234, moon=1.62, jupiter=24.79}.

name: exoplanet
description: a planet that exists outside of our solar system

name: (potentially) habitabal exoplanet
description: a planet thtat exists outside our solar system and has a surface temperature that can sustain liquid water

name: planet
description: orbits a star, massive enough to become gravitationally rounded.

name: rogue planet
description: a planet without a star or gravitationally bounding remnant to orbit

name: galactic coordinate system
description: a celestial coordinate system with our sun at the center.

name: Lorentz factor
description: measures the distortion of time and space on a moving object.

name: Proper Velocity
description: distance per unit time where time is measured by the moving object.

name: Interstellar Travel
description: travelling between stars (or planetary systems).

name: Planetary Habitability
description: ability to develop and maintain environments hospitable to life

name: solar flux/insolation
description: amount of solar energy reaching a planet, often measured in watts or joules/meter^2 and often over a time period. Measured here relative to earth (earth=1).

name: solar constant
description: amount of solar energy received by earth.

name: Planetary Equilibrium Temperature
description: theoretical temperature of a planet if it were to absorb all radiation from its parent star(s). Earth has an equlibrium temperature of 255K (-18c, -1f), but an actual temperature of about 288K(15c, 59f) due to greenhouse effects).
